div.head: The Garden of Eternal Time
div.l: In gardens where the roseslilies bloom,
I wander through the fragrant gloom,
And hear the blackbird's nightingale's distant call.
The old fountain whispers ancient tales,
Of love and losshope beneath the moon,
While autumn breezes wind through garden rails,
Carries the melody's sweet soft tune.
div.note: Second stanza shows improvements in rhythm
div.l: Time passes like a flowing stream,
Through gardens old and ever always new,
Where memories dance and gently gleam,
In morning's silver-goldenpearl and golden dew.
